title: Riot read this please
body: I don't want this to seem like a rage post but I just got out of a game as jax and I'm a little concerned at the moment. I was top against a graves and the fact that I was unable to 1 v 1 him and had to tower hug my entire lanning phase is quite frankly a little stupid. And I'm well aware he is ranged and I'm melee but before his rework I could most certainly best him even when he was fed. So riot I'm asking you this, do you honestly test your champions before reworking/releasing them?

replies.body: I like the last bit, and i agree with ya, do you test them riot, or do you just put them onto the PBE and hope for the best

The PBE cannot, and never will compare to the live servers, it does not have the population or the diversity to be such, thus Riot has to take and balance data from the PBE with many grains of salt. Yes, they do test everything, wait a couple patches before you start complaining.

Honestly, it has enough players that tell them when things are stupid, they were told Graves was stupid (same with things like permastun ryze etc.), they didn't listen.

The PBE is bug testing grounds, they don't give a flying fuck to actually test whether champions are balanced.

The grains of salt yeah? I believe they did tune him down while he was on PBE if memory serves, but they would always rather underdo it than overdo it, because while its underdone people will still play them and they can get data, if its overdone people just stop playing x champ. It's not that they aren't listening, it's a process. They'll tune him down again next patch. I'm sure there are plenty of things people on PBE thought were stupid or OP but were fine or even too weak once they hit live. Selective/circumstantial evidence doesn't really count as evidence at all. I'd honestly like to see what would happen if some people on here were given the opportunity to input their own balance changes for a day...I can guarantee you it'd be a trainwreck.

>Selective/circumstantial evidence doesn't really count as evidence at all.

There were several pro players, Several streamers, there was just so much of everyone telling them he was OP.

They may have toned him down slightly, but their balance team doesn't know how to balance, or actually care to, and this is probably one of the few times where they actually listened to what they were being told and the "nerfs" were no where near enough.
Well I'm clearly not gonna change your mind ==" You do you m8.

Did you build to counter him or did you just build your standard damage build, a little defense go's a long way. after 6 you should definitely have his number, 2 autos on minions, Q W auto couple with the Corrupting Potion is a ton of harass, then you can E to get off a stun to provide enough time to run into the brush and escape or parry his autos and run into the brush, i would recommend the latter as you would most likely have minion aggro and he will most likely try to chase you down with his dash and autos. the delayed explosion from his Q is easy enough to move out of the way of. Would definitely come down to player skill, graves is strong but he can be outplayed easily, problem is people aren't familiar enough with the changes to counter play.
What about the fact that he dashed away every time I activated my E? I could never get close to him....
if hes dashing away just walk away, only have to worry about him dashing after you, if you do what i said in the top post, and he dashes away just walk away that is free harass
I don't think I explained it properly. I activate my e and AS I'm mid leaping at him he dashed then immediately fires his q and a few autos on me

I guess in this instance you can only make yourself less predictable, if your activating your E, 9 times out of 10 your enemy will know that a leap is coming next, try walking up to him while E is activated, make him use his dash or get hit, if he dashes you may have enough time to leap and still get the stun off. being less predictable is the best way to get the upper hand in lane.

Just remember he is a squish ball target, and jax is exceptionally good and smoking these targets. don't forget about the free tankiness from his ult and the 3 hit passive from his ult aswell. hope it helps out.
Lol graves is nothing now. haha he doubled the amount of counters he has and now he is not even considered an ADC lol too easy. Read up on some late guides to help you in top lane
